treatment.description: Plants terrestrial, perennial. Stems erect, green, moderately branched, 30–50 cm. Leaf blades linear to triangular, 10–30 mm, apex mucronate. Inflorescences lax, flowers 2 per node. Pedicels 3–5 mm. Flowers 5-merous; sepals (erect), triangular, 1 mm, apex acute; petals narrowly triangular, 2–3 mm. Follicles erect, 6–10-seeded, ovoid; old follicles erect, boat-shaped. Seeds not seen.
treatment.discussion: Crassula tetragona is naturalized in southern California.
